question:
Consider the following comparisons of President and Vice-President of India:
  1. Both President and Vice-President are parts of Indian Parliament
  2. Both President and Vice-President are elected by same electoral college
  3. Doubt and dispute arising out of election of President and as well as Vice President can be challenged only in the Supreme Court
Which among the above statements is / are correct?
explanation:
• Both President and Vice-President are parts of Indian Parliament: This is an incorrect statement because vice-president is not part of Indian Parliament. Â The Constitution of India provides for a bicameral Parliament consisting of the President and two Houses known as the Council of States (Rajya Sabha) and the House of the People (Lok Sabha).
  • Both President and Vice-President are elected by same Electoral College : This is obviously incorrect because the Electoral College is different for election of President and Vice-President of India.
  • Doubt and dispute arising out of election of President and as well as Vice President can be challenged only in the Supreme Court: This is a correct statement.
